dialogues.text: He's crazy, David. I thought you  were the crazy one, but it's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull puts the gun to Barbosa's head, addresses Chino:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chino, pick up the suitcase and give  it to Elias. I'll only kill him if  something goes wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chino moves to pick up the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at Hull amazed, even Chino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Fucking A, John...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the money in the limo truck, slams the lid. He' running the show now, and everyone knows it. He's winging it, but confident and strangely calm. Elias, energized by Hull's command, grabs Barbosa and thr him toward the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Shit! Shit! (aiming rifle; Hull  in sights) Enough of this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull shepherding everyone into the limo. He glances towar the van. On instinct. He pulls Chino to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chino's head explodes. Betty screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming at van) Don't shoot... Don't shoot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taft hurling Hernandez against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddam it, what the hell are you  doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRENS. GUNFIRE. Elias drags Barbosa into the limo. Hull  throws Betty into the front seat. The limo takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull driving, Betty up front. Elias with a gun on Barbosa back. Hull slaloms the limo through police GUNFIRE. Windo are blown out. Glass everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weeping) I asked for this... I asked for it...  It's my fault...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm, eyes on road) Relax. We'll make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, stunned yet soothed by his certainty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a cop. He has to be. How else  would he have known?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was cop, you'd be face down  back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole thing smelled. Changing  his mind about the stuff. Meeting us  way out here. And I'd seen cops in  that van before. Hernandez is dirty,  that's who he's using.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Barbosa) Get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing. Taft at wheel, raging at Hernandez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you, man? Who the fuck are  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stonewalling) I'm me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He traded us to the cops. Just like  Eddie. Eddie, who was nice to my  daughter, had to die because that's  the rule. And you were vulgar about  my wife, Felix, so at the very least  the same rule applies to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you money. I'll give you a  million. Anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to get out of the car.  Get out of the fucking car. Out of  the fucking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (near tears) No, no... we can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning around from  front seat) Stop it, David, or we're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias wheels on him, sticks the gun in his face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a fury) Look at my hands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds them up: swollen, black and blue, cut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to  Barbosa, softly) Get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbosa's frozen. Elias grabs his hand, SHOOTS a bullet  through. Barbosa screams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias wheels on them, swinging the gun from one to the ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of this, or you'll die.  You'll both die. Everyone'll die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His fury makes anything seem possible. He pushes open the door. Trembling, Barbosa starts to climb out. The limo enters a tunnel, police still in pursuit. Halfway out, Barbosa stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias SHOOTS him in the butt. He shrieks, jerks forward. cops are getting close behind. Other cops waiting at the far end of the tunnel. Hull hits the brakes, spins a 180 into the opposite lane. Barbosa is flung out of the car and plastered by a succes of fishtailing vehicles. Hull speeds back the other way. They're going straight at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taft and Hull, the two drivers, lock eyes. It's chicken, more than that. Two men set against each other who, for s reason, want to be friends. At the last instant, the van swerves away, but:

dialogues.speaker: ELIAS AIMING AT TAFT
dialogues.text: Taft sees the gun too late. He can do nothing. Hull's gaze follows Taft's. He sees Elias, deliberately  swerves, sending the SHOT wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to kill a cop?? Don't be  stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows shot out. Hull and Betty silent, shaken. Elia charged up, happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is different. We're the  Colombians now. (radiant) This is the greatest night of my  life. Terrible but great. Felix was  right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appalled) About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said I should kill a man. He was  right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbosa was a roach. Do you miss  him? Will anybody in the world miss  him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a roach, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily) Yes. Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hull) What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's silent, keeps driving. She's had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Stop the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brakes to a stop. She jumps out, leans back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) No more laundering, no more anything.  I'm finished with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she disappears into the night. Elias watches her go.  Hull resumes driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows too much. We have to kill  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! She's with me. She's not going  to talk. (looks at Elias) You touch her, I'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's your responsibility then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull accepts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We're going to get the money now,  John. Enough for the new drug. We're  going to be rich. We're going to be  so rich that we're going to leave  the world of ordinary people and  going to a higher realm. I mean that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to come after us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact) It's a hardball game. We're hardball  players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hernandez comes out of a bodega with groceries, wine and woman. He nuzzles her as he lets her into his car. As he' getting behind the wheel, Molto (Gallegos' guard) stops t door from closing. The conversation is entirely in SPANIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It never is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SHOOTS him in the head. Hernandez slumps against the w The woman screams. Molto walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull finds a door, pushes the buzzer. Betty looks through the glass. She's afraid of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't kill me. I'm not going to talk.  I swear. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she looks closer and sees not murder in his face, bu need. She opens the door. Without a word, he gathers her him. She can't resist him now. Her mouth is everywhere on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty gasping in the wake of pleasure, turning her face a from him, she feels so exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hides her face in his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lie in each other's arms, relaxed together for the f time. A wonderful, unprotected openness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Tell me about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half-kidding) Everything worth knowing you just  found you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs. They begin to make love again. Suddenly: AN EX HAND stroking Betty's hair. She gasps. A gun in Hull's ea Another in her face. Guns all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands pull him out of bed, leave her there alone. We see  Molto, two or three others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAMON GALLEGOS lays a bouquet of white lillies on a grave He kneels, whispers a prayer, crosses himself. He rises and walks to where Molto and the other guards ho Hull and Elias. Gallegos is in his thirties, more Europea than Barbosa. He has a distinctly mild manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's grave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An impudent question, but Elias seems strangely bright-ey despite the guns held on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife's. She died of leukemia three  years ago. (looks around) I like to be among the dead. They  never interrupt you. (turning to them) Felix Barbosa started out as a skinny  fourteen-year-old fucking Yankee  businessman in Bogata hotels. He  grew up. He made himself strong and  rich, but getting there made him  sick, and that killed him. So he  lost everything for the same reason  he'd gotten it in the first place.  Now we'll see if you can do as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PRIEST going by greets Gallegos who responds warmly. Th chat a minute in SPANISH. The Priest leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Felix owed me one million eight  hundred thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He addresses this to Hull; Elias feels left out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) When you killed him, you bought the  debt; now you owe it to me; you get  to keep thirty percent, like he did.  You have three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gallegos turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did Barbosa collect from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't know, you shouldn't  have killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices Hull's earring: two tiny dice, the spots made minuscule jewels. Unembarrassed, he fingers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Cute... Can I have that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without waiting for an answer, he yanks it out of Hull's and walks away, leaving Hull bleeding through his fingers before a stone cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A club on the corner. THROUGH A WINDOW we see a RAP ACT o the stage, their MUSIC pumping out onto the street. Hull  pulls up in a Jaguar. He and Elias go through a door adja to the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUSIC is still audible here, though muffled. Elias an Hull are pushing at door Gopher is trying to hold closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you in here. You killed  the man, and I loved him. I don't  want to have anything to do with  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias kicks it open, and they enter Gopher's tiny, misera domain. He's wearing some sort of negligee and an immense naked woman fills his bed. We still hear the MUFFLED MUSI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; apoplectic) I'm a sixty-three-year-old man! I'm  a grandfather! Would you hit a sixty- three-year-old white man? Would you  hit your own grandfather?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps him against  wall) Listen, you fucking monkey, you know  who owed him money, and we know you  know. Tell us or --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull pulls him off. Elias is angry. They struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll tell us. Gopher, just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning: deal with me or deal with Elias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't tell anyone it was me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUSIC continues OVER the following sequence:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias arguing with a dealer. He slaps him around.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON HANDS
dialogues.text: Money is exchanged. The money is stuffed in a satchel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well-dressed lawyer (30's) talking with clients, a  distinguished couple in their 60's. The door BANGS open and a secretary is unable to restrain Hull and Elias as they charge into the room. The lawyer i up on his feet, but Hull shoves him around as Elias polit explains to the clients that this will only take a moment

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON SATCHEL
dialogues.text: Hull's hands thrust more money in. It's getting full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A biker in leathers on hands-and-knees spitting blood ont the cement floor. Hull stands over him, fists clenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A satchel stuffed with money is latched, set next to anot latched one. A third is opened, money and jewelry dumped

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull looking into the trunk. Elias is beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is all the money?  We're still a million short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get laid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, we've got thirty-six hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slams trunk, moves  toward door) Pick me up at Jacqueline's in the  morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooner than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias gets in the car and drives off. Hull turns and a da American sedan pulls up alongside. Carver behind the whee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an order) Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he gets in) What are you doing here? You're going  to get me killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carver peels away fast. He's very angry, frightened, too, but that's hidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an indifference to Carver's authority we haven't  heard before. Hull isn't even aware of it, but Carver is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You violated a direct order to stay  away from that bust. As a result, a  police informant is dead, a state  senator was critically injured in  the tunnel pile up and a city  policeman was subsequently murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't blow my cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get smart with me, motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a shmuck, Gerry. I'm talking  to Gallegos. I'm collecting his money.  We can set him up right now. (NOTE: Carver arrives  somewhere and parks.  To be discussed, but  let's say, for now,  that we are:)

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: They get out of the car. Carver takes out a flask, has a  drink, offers it to Hull who declines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never have, never will. (puts the flask away) I want you to give me your gun. You're  coming in right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't understand) Coming in where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your assignment has been terminated.  You're not going out there again. If  I have to, I'll put you in custody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomprehending) I'm going to have Gallegos in two  days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carver says nothing. Suddenly Hull understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You're protecting him. You're  protecting Gallegos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carver snorts: ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) No, of course. That's why you wanted  to bust Elias and Betty. I was getting  close, and you wanted to cut this  off then... What is he, the new  Noriega? Helps you fight commies, so  you let him sell drugs to the niggers.  Two birds with one stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You violated orders, so you're  through. Don't make a conspiracy  theory out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) I'm through...? Then, I might as  well have a drink after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised, Carver reaches for the flask. As he does, Hull grabs him, pushes him out over the edge of the building,  holds him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now tell me the truth or they're  going to decide your troubles got  the best of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carver struggles. Hull pushes him out farther. Carver dan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the more reason to do what I  say. Jesus, Ger, I'm having trouble  holding on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the State Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull pulls him back in. Carver slumps against the wall, d greedily. Hull lets him for a moment, then takes the flas away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I told you, Gallegos's uncle is a  big deal down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guzman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guzman, right. Our government supports  Guzman because he's a moderate. That's  a right-winger who's pro-U.S. (he doesn't like it  either) If Gallegos got busted here, it would  hurt Guzman's political career there.  It's politics, John, not drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drugs is politics. Politics is  drugs... (sickened) Christ, Gerry, I dealt drugs. I killed  a man. Others died. What did I do  all this for? For nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to Washington, John. I'll  bring you with me. We'll have clout,  money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outraged) I didn't do this for clout or money.  You said we were gonna do some good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying's for college boys. (his head on fire) If all there is is power and money...  If all there is... then what am I  doing here? 'Cause I can get more  power and money out on the street, I  got more there already, than I'd  ever get kissing your ass in  Washington...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't do that, John. It's  not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? There is no me. We took care of  that. First I was a cop pretending  to be a dealer. Now I'm just a dealer  pretending to be a cop. Why not stop  pretending...? Quit the force. Be a  dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My assignment's already terminated.  All I have to do is quit. I hereby  quit. (lifts the flask) My first one. (drinks) Not so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slips the flask in his pocket, gets in the car, starts engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't blow your cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull drives off, leaving Carver alone on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets him in, sees the distress in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head, drops onto the couch. He takes out th flask, offers it to her. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you, my mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs, takes a drink. She's surprised, says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you came to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I come to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell me anything. Something  about you. Something real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long beat; another  drink) When I was young, I occasionally  stole things. (laughs to himself) My father died when I was ten. Right  in front of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The revelation is so sudden it surprises Hull as much as  Betty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Heart attack. He just fell down. He  said, "I love you," then died in my  arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds him, and he lets himself be held.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Tell me what's going on, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't want to talk  about that) You're not doing the stuff anymore,  are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls playfully at her nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Don't change the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard. John...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to tell without  telling) Things are getting, they're getting  a little... confusing. I had certain  plans, and people haven't come through  exactly as they promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you expect with those people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) It's not just those people. It's...  it's bigger than that. It's of  everybody. Present company excluded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to stop this, John, you  know that. You gotta get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost angry) No! This is what I'm supposed to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supposed to? Who said you're supposed  to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole fuckin' world. You think I  didn't try something else? But  everything funnels you right back  here. Like it's where you had to go  all along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know what you're doing, don't  you, selling this stuff? Doing to  our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I tried to get out now, they'd  kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tortured) I can't be with somebody's who  involved in drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods. He knows. He's even happy about it. But she won' yield. Finally he gets up and walks back out the door. EXT. GOPHER'S BUILDING - 4 A.M. The neighborhood is reminiscent of the one where Joe Stev Sr. was killed. The rap club still pumps MUSIC onto the 4 A.M. streets where whores, junkies, children, teenagers w beepers and Nikes, welfare mothers roam as if it were day anywhere else. Their eyes, yearning, sullen, vital, hopel and hoping stare at...

dialogues.speaker: HULL
dialogues.text: Everyone knows what he is: the Black Man with the Big Car They don't remember when he was just another hustler maki street buys. Now they hate him, revere him, want to be hi not caring what it entails. Every eye follows as... He and Elias cross the street toward Gopher's door. Hull' eyes don't go right or left. He's a driven man now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gopher has just been roused from sleep. A light in his fa Hull and Elias looming over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There've got to be more. We have a  million two, we owe Gallegos one  eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you everyone. Everyone who  owed him, everyone he... One eight?  He's lying. Barbosa barely owed him  a million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull and Elias look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taft is showing her photocopies of phone bills, bank  transactions, invoices. She's obviously upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got every money transfer, every  phone call, all your laundry tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (miserable) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you'll go away 'til you're a dried  up old woman, and when you come out,  ain't nobody gonna want you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She covers her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias driving a car we haven't seen before and snickering himself at some private joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you laughing at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias shakes his head: nothing. He laughs. They pull into the lot beside a movie theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Technicolor Spanish melodrama is winding to its lurid e A door in back opens, and a burst of daylight reveals Hul and Elias being brought in by a guard and met by Molto. Molto and the guard frisk them, take their guns and money satchels, make them wait a moment until... The movie ends. The house lights come on revealing Ramon Gallegos as the  only spectator in the theater. He beckons. Molto and the  guard bring Hull and Elias down the aisle to him. Gallegos looking in the satchels. A tense moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't one eight. (off Gallegos) It's a million one. That's all Barbosa  owed, it's all we're paying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gallegos is stern for a moment, then laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big brass balls. Collecting money  makes you strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody relaxes. Gallegos scribbles something on a piec of paper, hands it to the guard who feeds it into a fax  machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling our suppliers they got  paid. They'll be very happy. I'm  happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're happy. Everybody's happy.  It's a happy world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias seems a bit mad, but no one minds. He and Hull are  ready to go. He gestures to Molto, wants his gun back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how can I express my gratitude  for a job well done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want Barbosa's business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gallegos gestures to Molto to give them the guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, also, your business. All this.  Your money, your dope, everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull looks at Elias; what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) You're tougher than I thought, but  not that tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How tough is enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings up the gun and SHOOTS Gallegos in the head. Hull and the guards are frozen. Then everyone goes for a  gun. Elias SHOOTS the guard. Hull has his gun to Molto's  head and screams at Elias:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning don't shoot him. But Elias has no intention of do so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) Thank you, John. I couldn't have  done that without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely able to speak) Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't believe it: the guy he's been after the whole ti is dead on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You taught me to take my work  seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here, David?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're taking over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing too much stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm very clear. I'm very, very  clear. (to Molto) Ahora, usted nos assistamos. Enteindo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molto nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull, Elias and Molto getting into their car. Molto is  recalcitrant. Elias pistol whips him. Hull stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car passes through a development of suburban homes. T enter a driveway. Two boys play in the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Molto) Donde esta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molto is silent. Elias FIRES a bullet right between his f Molto jumps. The boys turn. Hull grabs the gun away. We f the toll Elias's madness is taking on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It works, John. It works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, indeed, Molto is pointing to a Winnebago parked at t rear of the property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnebago. With a tire iron, Hull snaps off the padlock t holds the rear door closed. He opens the door. Money gush out. He slams it closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He, Elias and Molto are on hands and knees scooping it up

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: Molto tied to a tree. Elias is giving him instructions wh strangely, removing Molto's shoes and socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Molto) Disce a Senor Guzman que... (his Spanish isn't  good enough) ...that we have his money, and we're  willing to talk as soon as he comes  to town. We'll know how to reach  him. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molto just glares at him. Elias smiles, takes the shoes a socks and all the contents of Molto's into the Winnebago, and he and Hull drive away, leaving the car behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Winnebago enters the garage, Elias greeting the atten "Hey, Frank." Frank waves him in. The garage is filled with various RVs. Hull pulls the  Winnebago into an empty spot beside Elias's car and gets  out. Elias remains in the cabin making calculations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approximating the cubic capacity and  depending on the denominations of  the bills, it's somewhere between  fifty million and two hundred million  dollars. Right back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he does, Hull checks his gun, walks around behind the  vehicle and prepares to shoot Elias in the back of the he through the open window. Elias finishes his money report, and sits there as if unaware of Hull, but:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; not  turning around) Think I'm crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (blowing up, gun still  on him) I can't believe you got us into this.  All of fucking Latin America is going  to be after our asses, including  Renaldo Guzman who's friends with  fucking George Bush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know they're coming after us. I  want them to. We'll give them the  money, but we'll make a deal for  ourselves. We'll get what we need  for the synthetic drugs. I've thought  it all out. I've been thinking it  out for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull uncocks the gun, rubs it against his burning face. E turns around, embraces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We're going to have everything. Don't  you want everything, John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to get your family,  David. They'll kill your wife and  daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serene) Nancy and Miranda left the country  two days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew about this then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What about Betty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car SQUEALS to a stop. Molto and three thugs smash thro the glass door. They disappear into the store where thing can be heard BREAKING. They emerge a moment later, jump i the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull's car races up. He jumps out, dashes toward the buil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty PEOPLE on folding chairs. Hull enters on a dead run He stops short when he sees:

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: at the front. He signals to her, but she's already saying

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, my name is Betty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Betty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Betty, I'm a drug addict.  And I've been clean for nineteen  days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room bursts into APPLAUSE. She sees Hull at the back; signals to her, but she goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I've been using drugs and selling  them, and I've wanted to stop for a  long time, and the only way I did  was because I met a man I loved and  who loved me. I know that's not what  I'm supposed to say. I'm supposed to  say there was a higher power, and  maybe there was, behind it all, but  this man is strong and his love made  me strong enough that I could start,  or at least think about a life that  didn't have drugs in it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's looking right at Hull as she speaks. He's torn betw the danger he knows she's in and his emotion at what she' saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull hurrying Betty toward his car. She's protesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molto and men pouring through it. In frustration, Molto  smashes the table Hull had fussed over when Elias put his feet up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull and Betty hurry toward his room carrying shopping ba a newly bought suitcase. They see...

dialogues.speaker: COPS
dialogues.text: They freeze, turn, ready to bolt. But more cops behind th A panic, yet no one's coming after them. They walk on. Th cops are going into and coming out of Belinda's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fat Blonde Woman is talking to a policewoman. James s on the bed staring at...

dialogues.speaker: BELINDA
dialogues.text: who lies dead on a floor littered with crack vials. Hull  picks up a vial, holds it up to the Blonde Woman with a  question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) She got a fever and just burned up.  She just burned up all of a sudden.  It must have been bad stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating James) He shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes his hand) Come on, James, we'll go get a  burrito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy allows himself to be led out. Betty looks at Hull who's in a private hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull and Betty are about to enter Hull's room. The door i ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taft stands at the dresser. He's found Hull's collection memorabilia and is looking at the photo of his children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute kids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry at the invasion) Give me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches away the photo, but not before Betty sees it. She reaches out her hand. He reluctantly turns it over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something, who the fuck are  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull doesn't answer, collects the rest of his things,  including the bloody money, stuffs it back in the envelop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) 'Cause I don't think you're quite  the asshole you're trying to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mr. Taft, that's your name,  right? Leave me alone. I got things  on my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd think you would. You better have  your goddamn life on your mind, or  it's gonna get away from you. It's  gonna burn up like that poor woman  across the way. Like all of you's  gonna burn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you do, Mr. Taft, except  chase bad guys up and down the street  with your dirty partner, never  catching anybody important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do what I can. Do you do what you  can? (Hull says nothing) Maybe my partner was dirty. Maybe  the chief's dirty. And the mayor.  And the President. Maybe God Himself's  taking something on the side. That's  their problem. But I'll bust 'em if  I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without force) Get out of my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't deny who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves. Hull turns to Betty who is still holding the p of his children. He gently takes it, looks at it, seems t draw both succor and pain from it. He gets out Carver's flask and tries to drink, but it's e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're my children. They live in  Cleveland with their mother. I'm  divorced from her. I haven't seen  them in... some time. I want to, but  I haven't been able to arrange it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much else don't I know about  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to make a  joke) Everything else... Everything else  is... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taft has all the evidence about my  laundering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull's upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to put me in jail for a  long time unless I give you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. So, I've got to get away.  Far away. But I need money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Money? I got money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He empties his pockets of all that gushed out of the  Winnebago, empties a satchel as well until it fills the r like snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull putting Betty into an airport limousine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the driver) International terminal. (to Betty) I'll meet you there in a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him. He's about to close the door. She stops i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the first time, when I saw  you in the bar...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles at the memory) You wouldn't even look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I knew what you were thinking.  You were judging me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I wasn't, I was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were. Your eyes were like an  angel in my heart telling me I should  be good, and I didn't want to hear  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This news startles Hull, yet, strangely, he senses its tr and the sweetness is more than he can bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) That's you, too. Maybe this is you,  I don't know, but I know that's you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door. The car pulls away. In an unmarked car up the street, Taft picks up the radio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A limousine pulls into the gate and disgorges RENALDO GUZ 55, and his wife, 25. They're shown into the consulate. The limousine pulls out onto the street and parks. Gopher appears, knocks on the driver's window. It comes down. Th chat briefly in Spanish. Gopher opens up a cellular phone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overlooking the ocean. Hull pacing nervously, Elias relax reading the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we forget all this? Take ten  million each and disappear. Leave  the country. New identities, new  lives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, John? Having  doubts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phone RINGS. Elias picks up his own cellular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Where?... No! No way... We  pick the time and place... Otherwise  no meet... (looks to Hull who  nods his agreement) Got a pencil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gopher hands a piece of paper to the limo driver. He walk away...

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: As he's about to get into a car, Taft grabs him. Gopher i surprised and not pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Hull and Elias left the Winnebago. Guzman's limo  approaches. Frank, the attendant, waves it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo climbs the ramps until it comes to Elias's car,  parked where the Winnebago was; the Winnie is nowhere in  sight. The limo pulls alongside. Hull and Elias get out. Molto gets out of the limo. Then  Renaldo Guzman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a proposal to make. We regret  what happened to your nephew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what you have to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all know that your cousin's  business is coming to an end. Costs  have climbed while profits and the  market --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guzman waves: get to the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We have developed a new product:  simpler, cheaper to manufacture,  superior quality and completely  synthetic. Therefore, no growing, no  refining, no peasants, no importing,  no customs agents... Here's a detailed  prospectus with anticipated cash  flow and so forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands a copy to Guzman and the lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Molto, teasing  Elias) The racist Americans just want to  cut us poor Hispanics out of the  market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no Americans anymore, Mr.  Guzman, you know that. No Hispanics,  no Japanese, no blacks, no whites,  no anything. There are only rich  people and poor people. We're rich,  so we're on the same side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taft with Gopher in his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they have money in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wouldn't meet here otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gopher shrugs; a decision: Taft picks up his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Okay, everybody, here's the play...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're prepared to give you 80% of  the money. The remainder you invest  in our business with proceeds paid  out according to the figures there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates the prospectus that Guzman has been looking  through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This looks interesting. I'd have to  confirm everything, of course. Do  you have a sample of the product?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias produces one. Guzman gestures to Molto. Molto sampl it. Molto's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is our money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias hands him a key, points to a different Winnebago. M takes the key, unlocks the back: money. He signals okay t Guzman. Suddenly: SIRENS. Police cars wail into the garage. The T THWACK and sweeping light of a helicopter descend toward roof (though we never see the copter).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; anger) You set this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're after us, not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody scatters. The garage is a labyrinth of cement  stairwells, ramps, hundreds of RVs to hide between, under and so forth... Lots of NOISE, lights, but mostly we see  Hull and Elias dodging here, avoiding the action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molto caught between the lights. He draws his gun. GUNFIR He's cut down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Where are the rest of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars with rotating dome lights, but not many cops. Hull and Elias emerge from a shadowy doorway and make the way at a casual pace beyond the perimeter of police cars, quickly mingling with other spectators. They continue dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strolling now. Elias elated, uncontained joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did it. Twenty million. Twenty  fucking million. We're going to have  synthetics. We're gonna be rich.  We're gonna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull stops walking and just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What's the matter, John? Be happy.  Your whole life has just been solved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (behind them) Stop! Police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one motion, Elias draws his gun, turns and FIRES. The figure goes down. Elias can't believe he hit him. Hull starts toward the figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heading the other  way) John, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taft -- on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops to his knees. Blood oozes from Taft's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, what the hell are you doing?  Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull tries to hold closed the wound. The posture duplicat Hull with his dying father. He feels for a pulse. For bre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distraught) He's dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him die. Let him die twice. Come  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls at Hull who won't go. Hull does mouth-to-mouth.  Taft opens his eyes, looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Says to Taft whatever a CPR-trained  policeman would say in this  situation.] (to Elias) Get help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hull, getting it) Oh, man, you're a cop. You're a cop,  aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with difficulty, as  if against his will) Yeah, I'm a cop. I'm a fucking cop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Oh, really? Where's you badge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have one. I'm undercover.  Get help, David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, that's a cop. He tried to kill  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he didn't know. I don't know.  Maybe you don't know. Maybe you think  you're a cop because... because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the gun, put your hands against  the car. Spread your legs... Police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taft grunts once, stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) My God! Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pulse is gone. Hull begins to perform CPR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's say you're a cop. Be a  cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull keeps doing CPR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We've still got the money. We put it  into Randy's chemistry set. In five  years we're worth five hundred million  each, minimum. You'll be one of the  richest black men in America. Richer  than Cosby. Who gives a shit how you  got it? You think the white ones  were honest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull keeps working on Taft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Is this asshole all that stands  between you and greatness? Let me do  you a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts a gun to Taft's head and FIRES. In a reflex, Hull draws his own gun, SHOOTS Elias in the stomach. Stunned, wobbles backward a few steps. Sits on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Gee, John, that's kind of an extreme  reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull is stunned he did it. And this finally attracts the  police who see a black man with a gun who just shot a whi man. Hull goes to Elias who's dead. A POLICEMAN pulls him off, beating him with a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking nigger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull, bandaged, wearing prison blues, walking with Carver

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Guzman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He vanished, thank God, or we'd both  be in deep doo-doo. At least you got  Gallegos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elias did. And everything goes on as  before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the drug game. Plus a change...  I want you to come back to work for  me. You'll beat all charges on a  technicality and go back to who you  were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was I, Ger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone really know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have other things to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like travel? Tangiers, maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull looks at him; how did he know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm God, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He beckons him. He walks him over to a cell. Through a on way window they see:

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: alone in the cell, unaware she's being watched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to work, she walks out of  here. Otherwise, she's up on multiple  counts, and I'll see to it the judge  runs them consecutively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hull just looks at him. Carver shrugs apologetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely white. Not a window, not a stick of furniture. The only deviation is Hull in prison blues. The door opens, Betty comes in wearing prison yellows. Sh sits on a nearly invisible chair. They know they're being watched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want me to testify against you.  I said I wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to. It's all set up. That's  how you're getting off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head in cynical understanding. How difficu it is to get back to an honorable life. He takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; with  difficulty) My father didn't have a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He was shot robbing a liquor store.  Trying to rob it. I lied about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, why are you telling me this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to start somewhere... There're  other things you don't know...

dialogues.speaker: HULL AND BETTY
dialogues.text: Silent. Kissing. Beginning to make love. Hull extracts  himself, gives the finger to the POV and stuffs a bit of  tissue in the iris, blocking our view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carver takes his eye from the now obscured peephole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A funeral. Taft's wife and children (from the wallet phot leave the graveside with the rest of the funeral party. When everyone is gone, Hull approaches the grave. From hi pocket, he removes the four blood-soaked bills his father gave him, and wedges these among the stems of flowers tha already cover the plot. He's silent a moment, then he gets up. He joins Carver wh standing with Hull's children. The kids each take his han they walk together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty walked out of court free this  morning. That's my side of the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the children) You two run on ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do. Hull watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her probation gets revoked the minute  you fuck up. I want you to stay away  from her altogether.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the difference between a  black man and a nigger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carver smiles, shakes his head. He likes a good joke. Hul punches him so hard in the stomach that he goes to his kn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The nigger's the one who'd even think  about doing what you tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks away. Still on his knees, doubled over, Carver  whispers after him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't blow your cover.
